byline.contributor: Thom Shanker and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, Michael S. Schmidt from Baghdad, and Elisabeth Bumiller en route to Indonesia.

abstract: Pres Obama announces that the last American soldier will leave Iraq by the end of 2011, drawing to a close a divisive eight-year war that cost the lives of more than 4,000 troops; the announcement caps a remarkable period of foreign-policy accomplishments for Obama and fulfills one of his campaign promises.
snippet: The decision will draw to a close a divisive war that cost the lives of more than 4,400 troops and helped ignite President Obama’s rise.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: The decision will draw to a close a divisive war that cost the lives of more than 4,400 troops and helped ignite President Obama’s rise.

headline.main: U.S. Troops to Leave Iraq by Year’s End, Obama Says
headline.sub: But Obama Leaves Door Open for Training Mission
headline.print_headline: Last U.S. Soldiers To Exit From Iraq In 2011, Obama Says
